entry.tran: 相反的;成反比的;相逆的
entry.def: If there is an inverse relationship between two things, one of them becomes larger as the other becomes smaller.

example.ex: The tension grew in inverse proportion to the distance from their final destination.
example.tran: 拉力的大小与他们离终点的距离成反比。

entry.def: The inverse of something is its exact opposite.

example.ex: There is no sign that you bothered to consider the inverse of your logic.
example.tran: 你根本就不想把你的逻辑反过来考虑。

means.word_mean: 1. in an inverse or contrary manner;

sentences.sentence: "wavelength and frequency are, of course, related reciprocally"- F.A.Geldard

auth_sentence.content: Wave length is related inversely to wave length.
auth_sentence.res_content: Wave length is related inversely to wave length.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wave length is related inversely to wave length.

auth_sentence.content: Daily hours of sunshine are inversely proportional to amount of rain.
auth_sentence.res_content: Daily hours of sunshine are inversely proportional to amount of rain.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Daily hours of sunshine are inversely proportional to amount of rain.

auth_sentence.content: Bond yields move inversely to their prices.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bond yields move inversely to their prices.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bond yields move inversely to their prices.

Sentence.sentence: Bond prices generally fluctuate inversely (相反地)with current market interest rates.

sentences.en: Pressure varies directly with temperature and inversely with volume.
sentences.cn: 压力随温度成正比例变化,与容积成反比例变化。

sentences.en: The amount of force needed is inversely proportional to the rigidity of the material.
sentences.cn: 需要的力度与材料的硬度成反比。
